statutoryBodies.name: Private Health Services Regulatory Council (PHSRC)
statutoryBodies.statusNote: Established by Section 6, constituted 2007. Body corporate with perpetual succession (S.7). Operational but limited public reporting.

exOfficio.role: Provincial Director of Health Services (each province)

nominated.role: Representative of the Sri Lanka Medical Association
Representative of the Independent Medical Practitioners' Association
Representative of the Sri Lanka Nursing Council
Representative of the Pharmaceutical Society of Sri Lanka
Representative of the Sri Lanka Dental Association
Representative of the College of Medical Laboratory Technologists
Representative of private hospitals (nominated by recognized association)

meetings.frequency: Not specified in Act — Council sets own procedure

powers: Register private medical institutions through Provincial Directors (S.3)
Develop standards, norms, and evaluation methods for private medical institutions (S.9(a))
Implement quality assurance and quality improvement programmes (S.10(a))
Develop standards for staffing levels and qualifications (S.10(b))
Collect and maintain data on private medical institutions (S.10(c))
Grade registered institutions based on standards (S.10(d))
Inspect private medical institutions without prior notice, at any time by day or night (S.14)
Delegate duties and functions to members or committees (S.11)
Make rules on infrastructure, staffing, and disposal standards (S.19)
dataGaps: No publicly available meeting records or minutes
Accreditation schemes under S.13 not known to be implemented
Registration fee schedule and actual fee amounts not publicly documented
Number of registered institutions not publicly reported
Complaint resolution mechanisms and outcomes not documented
Grading system under S.10(d) — implementation status unknown
Annual reports, if any, not publicly accessible

timeline.details: Enacted as Act No. 21 of 2006. Provides for mandatory registration of private medical institutions, establishes the Private Health Services Regulatory Council (PHSRC), and repeals the Nursing Homes (Regulations) Act, No. 16 of 1949 (Chapter 220).
The Private Health Services Regulatory Council was constituted under Section 6, chaired by the Director-General of Health Services. 28-member body corporate with perpetual succession.

tiers.name: Minister
tiers.relationship: Policy authority: makes regulations (S.18), approves accreditation schemes (S.13), appoints 16 Council members (S.6(2)(e)-(o))

tiers.name: Private Health Services Regulatory Council (PHSRC)
tiers.relationship: Regulatory body corporate (S.7): develops standards (S.9-10), registers institutions via Provincial Directors (S.3), recommends accreditation schemes (S.13), makes rules (S.19)

tiers.name: Provincial Directors of Health Services
tiers.relationship: Registration agents: receive applications (S.3(1)), forward to Council with recommendations, remit 50% of registration fees to Council (S.3(3))

tiers.name: Private Medical Institutions
tiers.relationship: Must register (S.2), comply with standards and rules (S.19), subject to inspection (S.14)

currentReplacement.national: Ministry of Health — policy oversight; PHSRC — regulation and standards; replaces Nursing Homes Advisory Board (1949 Act repealed)
currentReplacement.provincial: Provincial Directors of Health Services — registration processing and fee collection
